intro: Corchorus deccanensis, commonly known as the Deccan knotweed, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stem and alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on pedicels. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is also valued for its fibrous stems, which have been traditionally used in local crafts and textiles.
